commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Now I'd like everyone to start off by sharing their ideas about what kind of event you want the School Idol Festival to be.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: What do you mean?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hmm, well...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: First and foremost, it's a cultural festival created by school idols and the people who love school idols, right?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Right, but that's a bit too vague to set as a theme for the event. I want us to have a more clear, common theme.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Okay, why don't we all take turns saying what we imagine the event will be like, zura?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: When I think of cultural festivals, I picture lots of stands and booths!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: I know what you mean! There's yakisoba noodles, okonomiyaki, crepes, and maid cafes!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: If we need a maid, Kotori has us covered.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: N-Nozomi?! N-Now whatever could you be talking about...? Ahaha...

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Well, you can leave the stands to me! I'll make mountains of Niceoodles!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: And I'll make my special Brand New Stewshine!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: While the enthusiasm is much appreciated, I believe we will need approval from the health department to handle food. We had to display our license at the beach hut too.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: I don't imagine the application process would be easy for a bunch of students.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: And we need to consider our budget. What amount of ingredients do we need to buy to make sure we don't run out?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I had no idea there was so much to think about when setting up booths.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Well, we've still got time to draw up the budget and get licensed, so let's make sure we do all the necessary research and plan accordingly.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: So what else do you find at cultural festivals? Exhibits and stuff?

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: There are usually haunted houses and carnival stands, zura.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Now hold up! W-We can skip the haunted houses! Like, I'm sure there are a ton of people who are freaked out by them!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Really? I love them.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I know they're scary, but something makes me wanna go in and check them out!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: If you know they're scary then why would you even go near them?!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Ohhh, I get it...

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: N-No, you don't! I'm not...!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: It's okay if you don't want to say it in front of everyone, Kanan. If we're not doing a haunted house, how about a fortune-telling booth?

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: That's not a bad idea. Lots of people love fortune-telling.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Mwahaha! It seems the time for the great fallen angel Yohane has come at last! I will lead the way for my lost little demons!

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Oh yeah, didn't you try doing that in front of the whole class that one time, Yoshiko? That really takes me back.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Oh yeah, I remember everyone was kinda weirded out when you took out your black robe and candles, zura.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Hey! Cut it out! Don't go pulling skeletons out of my closet! And it's Yohane!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: S-Skeletons...?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: So what else is there?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Some places hold beauty pageants.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Hmm, but since it's a school idol event, wouldn't it be better to have something more school idol-related?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Kanata's right. We can't just fill the festival with events and stalls and think it'll work. Why don't we try moving a little away from the cultural festival idea?

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Hey, I wonder what other past School Idol Festivals have been like?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: I bet Nico-chi and Hanayo might know a thing or two about that.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: We should ask them later.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: But we're in charge this year, so I wanna do a bunch of new stuff too!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Yeah! We want regular attendees to find our take on the festival new and fun, right?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: However, the more exhibits we plan, the larger the venue needs to be.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: And naturally, it would mean that we'll need more people to manage the event.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: But it'll just be a regular old school idol event if all we do is put on live shows, don't you think?

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: We gotta make it something really special.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Why don't we have some kind of common theme running through all the performances?

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: All of our groups have their own unique flair, so I want to make sure we preserve that.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yeah, I don't think it'd be a good idea to make any of us do something we're not comfortable with.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: *Sigh* Looks like we've got a lot of problems to deal with from the get-go.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: It seems we'll need to split this into things we need to do immediately and things we still must think about.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: So this is the kinda tough stuff the Festival Committee had to do...

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: What with having to meet with all the involved parties, brainstorming ideas, making all the preparations, and then seeing it through to the end... It's no small task at all.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Yeah. The whole reason we're able to be school idols is because of this kind of support from all sorts of people.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: We went through all this effort to get together, but we've barely made any progress at all.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Hmm. I guess consolidating our ideas is a lot easier said than done, huh?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: It's usually so easy to decide when it's just us among our own groups. What's so different?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Maybe it's because we know ourselves. We have a solid idea of what makes us who we are and how we want to express that, through our songs or our costumes or anything else.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Then why don't we try taking the first step to defining that image for all of us, together?

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Huh? Like what?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Well, for school cultural festivals and athletic festivals, you would generally start off by thinking of a slogan.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: That's right. We start by creating a slogan whenever we plan for events at my school as well.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Then that's it!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: All right! First thing's first, let's think up a slogan for the School Idol Festival!
